skill.name: 2026-coach
skill.description: Executive coaching skill that helps you plan your 2026 using research-backed process goals. Guides you through discovery questions, creates outcome goals, converts them to daily behaviors, and sets up accountability systems. Use when you want to plan your year, set goals, or need a coach to help you stay focused.
skill.summary: Executive coaching skill that helps you plan your 2026 using research-backed process goals. Guides y...
skill.author: BayramAnnakov

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation-only skill containing only markdown files and system prompts. No executable code exists - the skill defines how the AI behaves as an executive coach but has no file system access, network capabilities, command execution, or any operational functionality. All static findings are false positives triggered by documentation patterns, not actual security issues.

content.value_statement: Setting goals for 2026 often leads to frustration when outcome goals fail. This executive coaching skill uses the proven process goals methodology that research shows is 15x more effective. It guides you through structured discovery, converts vague aspirations into daily behaviors you control, and builds an accountability system.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through strategic discovery about current state, vision, strategy, and available time
Creates structured goal hierarchies from annual outcomes to quarterly milestones to daily behaviors
Converts outcome goals into daily process goals that are 100% within user control
Generates markdown files for annual plans, weekly tracking, and coaching context
Provides accountability prompts for weekly reviews and motivation
Adapts questioning style based on available tools between Claude Code and Claude.ai
limitations: Does not execute tasks or access external systems on behalf of users
Cannot track user progress automatically without user input to each session
Only creates markdown files when users explicitly request and specify the save location
Requires users to provide honest answers for effective planning

use_cases.title: Plan your startup year
use_cases.description: Define your 2026 north star, break it into quarterly milestones, and establish daily behaviors.

use_cases.title: Strategic career planning
use_cases.description: Map out department goals, personal development targets, and daily actions that build influence.

use_cases.title: Build consistent habits
use_cases.description: Transform creative ambitions into reproducible daily routines with weekly tracking.

prompt_templates.title: Start coaching session
prompt_templates.prompt: Please act as my executive coach and help me plan my 2026 using the process goals methodology. Start by asking me about my current situation.

prompt_templates.title: Convert my outcome goal
prompt_templates.prompt: My outcome goal for 2026 is [describe goal]. Help me convert this into daily process goals I can control 100%.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly review session
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me do my weekly review. Did I hit my process goal targets? What worked? What did not work?

prompt_templates.title: Create tracking files
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on our conversation, create my 2026_PLAN.md, COACHING_CONTEXT.md, and WEEK_01.md files.

output_examples.input: I want to grow my SaaS to $100K MRR by December 2026
output: Your annual outcome goal: $100K MRR by Dec 2026
Daily process goals (what you control): Send 20 outbound messages daily
Q1 milestone: Reach $15K MRR with validated acquisition channel
Q2 milestone: Reach $35K MRR with scalable playbook

output_examples.input: Help me plan my first book
output: Your annual outcome goal: Published book by Dec 2026
Daily process goal: Write 500 words before breakfast
Weekly review: Check word count, identify writing blockers

output_examples.input: I need to get fit this year
output: Your annual outcome goal: Better health and fitness by Dec 2026
Daily process goal: Exercise 30 minutes before 9am
Accountability: Check daily completion, adjust schedule as needed

best_practices: Complete the full discovery phase before setting goals. The skill needs to understand your constraints and available time.
Be honest about your time availability. Process goals must be achievable within your actual schedule.
Use the COACHING_CONTEXT.md file in future AI sessions to give new conversations your full context.
anti_patterns: Setting process goals that depend on others. Process goals must be 100% within your control.
Skipping the weekly review. Without reflection, you lose visibility into whether goals are driving progress.
Using vague language in discovery. Be specific about your situation and what success looks like.

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code and Claude.ai?
faq.answer: Yes. In Claude Code, it uses structured questions. In Claude.ai, it asks conversational questions.

faq.question: How many process goals should I set?
faq.answer: Research suggests focusing on 3-5 daily process goals maximum that you control 100%.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Pair with ActivityWatch Analysis for focus time tracking. COACHING_CONTEXT.md works with any AI.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no file access, network calls, or code execution.

faq.question: What if I miss my daily targets?
faq.answer: Missing process goals is data, not failure. Use weekly reviews to identify barriers and adjust.

faq.question: How is this different from other goal-setting methods?
faq.answer: Most methods focus on outcome goals you cannot control. This uses process goals (d=1.36) for 15x better results.
